Text: Revised letter to WildhorseAttached is the revised letter that I am sending to Wildhorse Ken Wildhorse doc

RE Pressure DataWe have taken a first pass look through all the old San Arroyo files we received from Enogex There seems to be very little information on the gas gathering agreement There is a file on the gas gathering agreement but it is very incomplete and does not go back past Enogexs ownership I will fax you a letter from Lone Mountain to KN Energy dated concerning pressures on the Gathering system in the area including some of our nonop wells There is some old well by well data from that shows well flowing tubing pressures at San Arroyo in the psig range Gathering system pressures would need to be below those Some of the data is before the execution of the gathering contract amendment I can copy those and send them to you if you so desire Ken Krisa Original Message From Gerald Nemec mailto Sent Monday July PM To Subject Pressure Data Ken Wanted to check and see if you guys were able to find any pressure data on Wildhorse for the period of years prior to the Effective Date of the Gathering Agreement I think Jim was going to look and see if he had any such data Thanks

Pressure Data for WildhorseSince my last email we have found a file that has a field pressure study for the years prior to the execution of the Mesa Gathering Agreement It does not have anything in the file that relates it to the negotiations with Mesa but I am pretty confident this would be the information that the previous operators would have used to make some decisions We are still unclear whether the data presented is wellhead flowing tubing pressures or actual gathering system pipeline pressures Some of the data seems to match the FTPs We may have some data that could be used to compare against tubing pressures during the same time frame I am currently making a copy of the file and will see if we can also find a representative sampling of wellhead tubing pressures recorded during the same timeframe Once you get this information please call and we can discuss further Ken Krisa Crescendo Energy LLC

RE Crescendo Dec ProductionGerald Mark We do not physically flow our gas into Questar This means that our production is being curtailed through increased pressure for economic benefit to Wildhorse at Crescendos expense of moving more gas from the Natural Buttes area south through the San Arroyo area Ken Krisa Original Message From mailto Sent Monday December PM To Cc Subject Crescendo Dec Production Due to the Mesa Tap compressor being down at the interconnect between Wildhorse and Questar the pressure is backing up on Wildhorse These Crescendo wells are very sensitive to pressure thus current production is around mcfd mmbtud Our first of the month nom was mcfd mmbtud I am not sure if you want to reduce the nom now or wait a bit My gut feel is to keep the nom as is and get these higher prices assuming prices will come down later this month let me know what you think is best thanks joan

RE TBI Proposal Cc The existing gas gathering contract between Tom Brown and Wildhorse does not dedicate any South Canyon Acreage only three wells There is really no other place for South Canyon gas to go except some wells are tied to PSCO Most of the gas does not meet the quality specifications in the contract and is taken on a blend basis now Tom Brown has shutin wells at South Canyon Original Message From mailto Sent Tuesday February PM To Cc Subject TBI Proposal Attached are my comments to the TBI proposal Please review and let me know if you have any comments See attached file TBI Field Services bid response revREDdoc I also wanted to clarify a point on the Tom Brown form of gathering agreement The revised form is an interruptible agreement with no acreage dedication Since Tom Brown removed all the acreage dedication language it is my understanding that they were not willing to give us an acreage dedication To the extent we modeled our economics on any Tom Brown production I wanted to make sure everyone understands that these volumes are not committed to the system we are purchasing and can be taken by Tom Brown to someone else at their discretion

Revised Tom Brown Agreements Cc the proposed revisions to the Tom Brown PSA and Gas Gathering Agreement for South Canyon Production and proposal letter as Gerald and I have discussed These will be included in the package we will overnight to Petrie Parkman today Ken Krisa STD GATH AGRMT reddoc PSAred DOC TBI Field Services bid response revREDdoc

RE Crescendo Dec ProductionGerald Mark We do not physically flow our gas into Questar This means that our production is being curtailed through increased pressure for economic benefit to Wildhorse at Crescendos expense of moving more gas from the Natural Buttes area south through the San Arroyo area Ken Krisa Original Message From mailto Sent Monday December PM To Cc Subject Crescendo Dec Production Due to the Mesa Tap compressor being down at the interconnect between Wildhorse and Questar the pressure is backing up on Wildhorse These Crescendo wells are very sensitive to pressure thus current production is around mcfd mmbtud Our first of the month nom was mcfd mmbtud I am not sure if you want to reduce the nom now or wait a bit My gut feel is to keep the nom as is and get these higher prices assuming prices will come down later this month let me know what you think is best thanks joan

Revised Tom Brown Agreements Cc the proposed revisions to the Tom Brown PSA and Gas Gathering Agreement for South Canyon Production and proposal letter as Gerald and I have discussed These will be included in the package we will overnight to Petrie Parkman today Ken Krisa STD GATH AGRMT reddoc PSAred DOC TBI Field Services bid response revREDdoc

RE TBI Proposal Cc The existing gas gathering contract between Tom Brown and Wildhorse does not dedicate any South Canyon Acreage only three wells There is really no other place for South Canyon gas to go except some wells are tied to PSCO Most of the gas does not meet the quality specifications in the contract and is taken on a blend basis now Tom Brown has shutin wells at South Canyon Original Message From mailto Sent Tuesday February PM To Cc Subject TBI Proposal Attached are my comments to the TBI proposal Please review and let me know if you have any comments See attached file TBI Field Services bid response revREDdoc I also wanted to clarify a point on the Tom Brown form of gathering agreement The revised form is an interruptible agreement with no acreage dedication Since Tom Brown removed all the acreage dedication language it is my understanding that they were not willing to give us an acreage dedication To the extent we modeled our economics on any Tom Brown production I wanted to make sure everyone understands that these volumes are not committed to the system we are purchasing and can be taken by Tom Brown to someone else at their discretion
